sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Time.Delay procedure is used to cause the program to pause for a given time. The time duration is in milliseconds.
sections.mdown_content: The **Time.Delay **procedure is used to cause the program to pause for a given time. The time duration is in milliseconds.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 1 .. 10
            put i
            Time.Delay ( 1000 ) % Pause for 1 second
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints the integers 1 to 10 with a second delay between each.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints the integers 1 to 10 with a second delay between each.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Time.Delay, not by calling Delay.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
